required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Optimal Timing of Dinoprostone Administration Prior to Office Hysteroscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Optimal Timing of Dinoprostone Administration Prior to Diagnostic Office Hysteroscopy in Nulliparous Patients:a Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to determine whether dinoprostone administered 10 hours before office hysteroscopy can relieve pain more effectively compared with dinoprostone administered 3 hours before office hysteroscopy.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Intensity of pain by visual analog scale from 0(no pain) to 100 mm(worst pain imaginable)

arm_group.description: A small envelope including two labeled plastic bags (A & B) (each bag containing either 1 dinoprostone tablet(3mg) or 1 identically appearing placebo tablet) will be packaged in sequentially numbered sealed envelopes. In long interval dinoprostone group, bag (A) contains dinoprostone tablet and bag (B) contains placebo tablet. After signing the informed consent, the sequentially numbered sealed envelopes will be opened (according to the sequence of attendance of the patient) by the study nurse. Tablets in bag (A) will be inserted 12 hours before office hysteroscopy and tablets in bag (B) will be inserted 3 hours before office hysteroscopy.

A small envelope including two labeled plastic bags (A& B) (each bag containing either 1 dinoprostone tablets(3 mg) or 1 identically appearing placebo tablet) will be packaged in sequentially numbered sealed envelopes. In short interval dinoprostone group, bag (A) contains placebo tablet and bag (B) contains dinoprostone tablet. After signing the informed consent, the sequentially numbered sealed envelopes will be opened (according to the sequence of attendance of the patient) by the study nurse. Tablets in bag (A) will be inserted 12 hours before office hysteroscopy and tablets in bag (B) will be inserted 3 hours before office hysteroscopy.

In long interval dinoprostone group, bag (A) contains dinoprostone tablet and bag (B) contains placebo tablet. A small envelope including two labeled plastic bags (A& B) (each bag containing either 1 dinoprostone tablet(3 mg) or 1 identically appearing placebo tablet) will be packaged in sequentially numbered sealed envelopes. In short interval dinoprostone group, bag (A) contains placebo tablet and bag (B) contains dinoprostone tablet. After signing the informed consent, the sequentially numbered sealed envelopes will be opened (according to the sequence of attendance of the patient) by the study nurse. Tablets in bag (A) will be inserted 12 hours before office hysteroscopy and tablets in bag (B) will be inserted 3 hours before office hysteroscopy.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Nulliparous patients who have an indication for office hysteroscopy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Parous patients, menopausal patients and patients with cervical pathology, and previous cervical surgery will be excluded from the study. Moreover, patients with severe vaginal bleeding, allergy to dinoprostone
